Lincoln-Douglas.Sept-Oct '24: Resolved: The United States ought to require that workers receive a living wage.
Lincoln-Douglas.Nov-Dec '24: Resolved: The United States ought to adopt a wealth tax.
Lincoln-Douglas.Jan-Feb '25: Resolved: The United States ought to become party to the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea and/or the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court.
Lincoln-Douglas.Mar-Apr '25: Resolved: The development of Artificial General Intelligence is immoral.
Lincoln-Douglas.Nats '25: Resolved: Violent revolution is a just response to political oppression.
Lincoln-Douglas.Sept-Oct '25: Resolved: In the United States criminal justice system, plea bargaining is just.
Lincoln-Douglas.Nov-Dec '25: Resolved: The United States ought to rewild substantial tracts of land.
Lincoln-Douglas.Jan-Feb '26: Resolved: The possession of nuclear weapons is immoral.
Lincoln-Douglas.NOF Aug-Oct '25: Resolved: Physical education ought to be a major educational priority in K–12 schools.
Lincoln-Douglas.NOF Nov-Jan '25: Resolved: Democracy and social media are incompatible.

Public Forum.Sept-Oct '24: Resolved: The United States federal government should substantially expand its surveillance infrastructure along its southern border.
Public Forum.Nov-Dec '24: Resolved: The United States should substantially reduce its military support of Taiwan.
Public Forum.Jan '25: Resolved: The African Union should grant diplomatic recognition to the Republic of Somaliland as an independent state.
Public Forum.Feb '25: Resolved: The United States should accede to the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court.
Public Forum.Mar '25: Resolved: In the United States, the benefits of the use of generative artificial intelligence in education outweigh the harms.
Public Forum.Apr '25: Resolved: The United States federal government should substantially increase its investment in domestic nuclear energy.
Public Forum.Nats '25: Resolved: On balance, in the United States, the benefits of presidential executive orders outweigh the harms.
Public Forum.Sept-Oct '25: Resolved: The United Kingdom should rejoin the European Union.
Public Forum.Nov-Dec '25: Resolved: The United States federal government should require technology companies to provide lawful access to encrypted communications.
Public Forum.Jan '26: Resolved: The People’s Republic of China should substantially reduce its international extraction of natural resources.
Public Forum.NOF Aug-Oct '25: Resolved: Physical education ought to be a major educational priority in K–12 schools.
Public Forum.NOF Nov-Jan '25: Resolved: Democracy and social media are incompatible.

Policy Debate.24-25: Resolved: The United States federal government should significantly strengthen its protection of domestic intellectual property rights in copyrights, patents, and/or trademarks.
Policy Debate.25-26: Resolved: The United States federal government should significantly increase its exploration and/or development of the Arctic.

Big Questions.24-25: United States federal government should significantly increase its exploration and/or development of the Arctic.
Big Questions.25-26: Resolved: Moral systems rooted in theism are preferable to non-theistic moral systems.
